conclusion: The x-axis represents time (t) in seconds. The y-axis represents velocity (v) in meters per second (m/s). The curve shows how the velocity changes with time.

Acceleration (a) is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time, which can be found from the slope of the velocity-time graph. A straight line on the graph indicates constant acceleration. A curve indicates changing acceleration.
Between 1 and 2 seconds, the graph shows a curve that is decreasing. The red tangent lines illustrate the slope at different points on this curve.

premise: The slopes of these tangent lines are decreasing, indicating that the acceleration is decreasing over time.
conclusion: From 1 to 2 seconds, the particle is undergoing linear motion, but the acceleration is not constant; it is gradually decreasing.

conclusion: Yes, it is correct to say that the particle undergoes linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
